Community-based composting program: Create a community-based composting program where residents can drop off their food waste and yard trimmings at designated locations. This program would not only reduce the amount of waste sent to landfills but also provide a valuable resource for gardening and agriculture. Confidence score: 0.8

Circular economy hub: Establish a circular economy hub where residents can bring their recyclables, donate usable items, and purchase second-hand goods. This hub would create a space for the community to engage in sustainable practices and reduce waste. Confidence score: 0.9

Waste reduction challenge: Organize a waste reduction challenge where residents are encouraged to reduce their waste by a certain percentage over a set period of time. This challenge could be done through education, awareness campaigns, and incentives for reducing waste. Confidence score: 0.8

Repair café: Host a repair café where residents can bring their broken items and have them repaired for free or for a small fee. This would reduce the amount of waste generated from discarded items and promote sustainable consumption. Confidence score: 0.9

Community-based recycling program: Develop a community-based recycling program that educates residents on what can and cannot be recycled, and provides them with the necessary tools and resources to properly recycle their waste. This program would increase recycling rates and reduce waste in the community. Confidence score: 0.9
